com.googlecode.cqengine.index.standingquery

Class StandingQueryIndex<O>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.cqengine.index.standingquery.StandingQueryIndex<O>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ModificationListener<O>, Index<O>

    public class StandingQueryIndex<O>
extends Object
implements Index<O>
    An index which stores objects matching any type of query, and which can answer arbitrarily complex queries in constant time complexity.

    A standing query index must be added ahead of time for the exact query which is to be accelerated.

    Note that it is possible to add a standing query index on any fragment of a query, as well as whole queries. CQEngine will accelerate evaluation of query fragments (branches, or nested sub-trees within queries) using any standing query indexes which match those fragments.

    Author:
    Niall Gallagher

      • getStandingQuery

        public Query<O> getStandingQuery()

      • supportsQuery

        public boolean supportsQuery(Query<O> query)
        Indicates if the index can perform retrievals for the type of query supplied.

        This implementation always returns true, as this index supports all types of query.

        Specified by:
        supportsQuery in interface Index<O>
        Parameters:
        query - A query to check
        Returns:
        true, this index supports all types of query

      • retrieve

        public ResultSet<O> retrieve(Query<O> query,
                    QueryOptions queryOptions)
        Returns a ResultSet which when iterated will return objects from the index matching the query supplied.

        Usually ResultSets are lazy which means that they don't actually do any work, or encapsulate or materialize matching objects, but rather they encapsulate logic to fetch matching objects from the index on-the-fly as the application iterates through the ResultSet.

        Specified by:
        retrieve in interface Index<O>
        Parameters:
        query - An object which specifies some restriction on an attribute of an object
        queryOptions - Optional parameters for the query
        Returns:
        A set of objects with attributes matching the restriction imposed by the query
        See Also:
        Index.supportsQuery(com.googlecode.cqengine.query.Query)

      • onQuery

        public static <O> StandingQueryIndex<O> onQuery(Query<O> standingQuery)
        A static factory method for convenience.

        Equivalent to new StandingQueryIndex&lt;Query&lt;O&gt;, O&gt;(standingQuery).

        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of the objects in the collection being indexed
        Parameters:
        standingQuery - The standing query on which the index will be built
        Returns:
        A new StandingQueryIndex which will build an index on this standing query
